sense.notes: Tosef. Succ. I, 10 של קנים ושל ח' (a matting) of reeds or rushes; Succ. 20 a Ar. (ed. חילת, Ms. M. חולית). Sot. 49 b Ar. (ed. חילת).—Kel. XVII, 17.—[ Pl. חִילְפִין, v. חֲלִיפִין a. חֵלֶף.]

Gitt. 68 b bot.— Pl. חִילְפֵי, חִלְ'. Ḥull. 62 b, v. כְּרָזָא.—ח' דְיַמָּא sea-rush, Schoenanth, Juncus odoratus (v. Löw Pfl., p. 168; Sm. Ant. s. v. Schoenus), a spice. Gitt. l. c. חילפא וח' דימא rush and sea-rush. Ber. 43 b.—[Targ. Y. Num. XXI, 12 only חילפי, v. גַּלִּי.]

sense.definition: (חלף) a species of willow with serried leaves (v. preced.; Fl. to Levy Targ. Dict. I, 425 1 “so called from its fast growth”).

Rashi (ed. כי תניא האי בח' וכ') (‘a willow the leaves of which are not serried like the teeth of a saw, but like those of a sickle’) refers to a willow with rounded leaves.—[Ib. ח' ערבתא Rashi, v. חִלְפְתָא.]— Pl. חִילְפֵי. Sabb. 152 a סבותא כלילא דח' old age is a crown of willow rods (heavy to wear). Ib. 77 b. Snh. 44 a, v. אָסָא III.

(חָלַק; cmp. Lat. alica, halica, a. חֵילֶק I) split grain, grist, spelt used for halica (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Alica).
sense.notes: Makhsh. VI, 2 חילקה Mish. (Talm. ed. חֲלִיקָה). Y. Sabb. I, 3 c bot. M. Kat. 13 b ח' חדא לתרתי it is called ḥ elka when each grain is broken in two parts; Ber. 37 a Ms. ח' דמתברי באסיתא תרתי תרתי ḥ ilka is wheat pounded &c.—M. Kat. l. c. (another opin.) ח' כונתא ḥ. is spelt. Ib. it is called ḥ elka ( smooth), דשקיל חלקייהו Ar. (ed. דשקל) because its husks have been taken off (cmp. חֵילֶק II); v. חִלְקָא.
(v. חָלַשׁ) ( something rounded, hollow, v. P. Sm. 1295 חלשא specillum) reed. Targ. Zech. XI, 13 חי' כתבא (ed. Lag. חלש, ed. Ven. חִילַּשׁ) writing reed.

sense.definition: (v. חֵילַת II) assa foetida, an umbelliferous plant used, as a resin or in leaves, for a spice and for medicinal purposes.
sense.notes: Ukts. III, 5. Sabb. XX, 3 (140 a) אין שורין את הח' וכ' (Mish. ed. חִילְתִּין) you must not dissolve the resin of asa-foetida in warm water (on the Sabbath). Y. ib. XX, 17 c bot. מי ח' a solution of &c. Ib. ח' עצמה וכ' asaf. itself is used in food for healthy persons. Ḥull. 58 b (distinction between the medicinal properties of the gum and those of the leaves). Ab. Zar. II, 6 קורט של ח' tears of &c. (Ar. עלה וכ' leaves). Sifré Deut. s. 107; a. fr.
Ab. Zar. 39 a. Y. Shebi. VII, 37 c top חלתותא (corr. acc.).
, v. חֵמָה
Nidd. 20 b דם ח' discharge of blood owing to sexual appetite.
Gen. R. s. 48 הח' יפה וכ' basking in the sunshine is good for a wound; Yalk. ib. 82 החמין (corr. acc.).
M. Kat. 24 a בשעת ח' at the moment of excitement (immediately after a death in the family). Yoma 18 a לידי ח' to sexual excitement (pollution).
Gen. R. s. 31, beg. ח' ממון oppression in money affairs, ח' דברים violence in speech (blasphemous language).
m. ch. (חמע) = next w. Pes. 39 b, sq. Ms. M. (ed. חִימּוּץ).

Pes. 39 b שאינן באין לידי ח' which will not ferment (so as to become חָמֵץ). Ib., sq. (in Chald. diction) ואתי לידי ח' and may ferment. Bets. 7 b שחִמּוּצוֹ קשה which is a strong leavening agent. Y. Ḥall. I, beg. 57 a אין חִימּוּצוֹ חמץ ברור the fermentation which it produces is not real leavening. Nidd. 63 a כמה חִמּוּצָן how long must urin stand to be considered as fermenting?— Pl. חִימּוּצִין salads, v. חוּמְצָן.

sense.definition: (חמץ, v. Ges. H. Dict. 10 s. v. חמץ) shame.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XVII, 21 (h. text תוגה).
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (חמץ, v. Ges. H. Dict. 10 s. v. חמץ; cmp. Is. LXIII,
scarlet-colored garments, in gen. ח' רוֹמְיָתָא dyed Roman garments, contrad. to white (cmp. אוֹלָרִין a. בּוּרְדִּיקָא).
sense.notes: M. Kat. 23 a ח' ר' סומקתא חדתי ed. Ms. M. חימוציאתא דרומי, Ar. המיצתא, Mus. חמיצתא) Roman dyed garments, red and new.
, Nidd. 51 b, v. חֲמָם
, Gen. R. s. 45 some ed., v. חָמַס

sense.definition: a species of small peas (Cicer Arietanus).
sense.notes: — Pl. חִימְצֵי. Yeb. 63 a (Ar. חוּ'). Ḥull. 52 b (some ed. חִמְצֵי).
v. הִימְצָא

sense.definition: , asphalt (from its dark color, Ges. H. Dict. 10 s. v.), used as cement.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Gen. XI, 3. Targ. Ex. II, 3.—Targ. II Esth. III, 3 וריחא דגלגלוי כחוּמָרָא ed. Lag. (oth. ed. וריחא לגלוי בחו', read: דגַלּוֹי כח') and the odor of its billows is like that of asphalt.
Targ. Prov. XXVII, 4. Ib. XXIX, 11 (some ed. חוּ'); a. e.
, v. חֵן, חִנָּא.
, v. חֵנָא
— Pl. חִינְגַּיָא, חִינְגִּין, חִינְגֵּי, חִנְ'. Targ. Jud. IX, 27 (vintage feast).—Gitt. 57 a, v. הִילּוּלָא.

sense.definition: dancing place in the vineyards (v. מָחוֹל).
sense.notes: Targ. Lam. I, 4 (cmp. Taan. IV, 8).— Pl. as ab. Targ. Jud. XXI, 21; 23. Targ. I Sam. XVIII, 6.

sense.definition:
ḥ inga, name of a musical instrument (h.
מָחוֹל a. חָלִיל).
sense.notes: Pes. 111 b תלו ח' בגויה they had a ḥ. suspended in the hollow of the tree.— Pl. as ab. Targ. I Kings I, 40. Targ. Ps. V, 1 (h. text נחילות). Ib. CL, 4; a. fr.
Sabb. 54 b; Bets. 33 a כמאן דאזיל לח' like one going with his beast to market.
Targ. Ps. IV, 1 (ed. Lag. נְגִינָתָא, Ms. חִינְגָּנָתָא, v. next w.).
Targ. Ps. LXXXVII, 7 (some ed. חנגיא, h. text חללים).— Fem. pl. חִינְגָּנָתָא, v. preced.
Targ. Lam. V, 15.— Pl. חִינּוּגִין. Ib. I, 4.
Y. M. Kat. I, 80 d top איזהו ח' קברים what finishing of tombs (is meant in the Mishn. ib. 6)?
Men 78 a חִינּוּכוֹ his inauguration as a common priest, contrad. to המשחו his anointment as highpriest. Y. Shek. VI, 50 d top חִינּוּכוֹ his (the highpriest’s) inauguration.

sense.definition: gradual introduction of children into religious practice, training.
sense.notes: Yoma 82 a אי זה ח' wherein does the child’s training (to fast on the Day of Atonement) consist?—Ib. ומי קרי לח' השלמה is fasting the entire day called initiation?—Naz. 29 a ח' מדרבנן the training of minors for religious practices is a rabbinically ordained duty; a. e.
— Pl. חִינּוּכֵי, חִנּ'. Yoma 82 a תרי ח' הוו there are two modes of initiation (gradual training to fasting by hours, and making the child fast a whole day before he has reached religious maturity).

sense.definition: (חָנַן) prayer for grace, ḥ innun, one of the expressions for prayer, v. זְעָקָה.
sense.notes: Sifré Deut. s. 26 (ref. to Deut. III, 23); (Deut. R. s. 2 תחנונים; Yalk. Sam. 157; Yalk. Deut. 811 תחנה).
[Ar. s. v. חן: Ḥ innunitha, pr. n. pl.]
, v. sub חִנְ'.
Gitt. 69 a לח' for pains of the jaws. B. Kam. 35 a כייבין ליה חִינְכֵיה Ms. H. (ed. כיבין) had pains in his jaws.
[Vers. frequ. vary with הנינא, חגא). Pes. 75 a רב ח' סבא (Ms. M. חגא).—Ib. Ḥ. bar Idi (Ms. M. חנינא). Y. Maas. Sh. II, beg. 53 b; (Y. Yoma VIII, 45 a top חנניה); a. fr. V. Fr. M’bo, p. 84 a, sq.
, v. חַנָּסָא
Targ. Ex. XII, 27 (ed. Amst. חַיָּס, חַיְיסָא). Targ. Jer. IV, 4. Targ. Is. I, 31; a. e. [Targ. Prov. III, 25, v. חֵיפָא I.]
, v. sub חִסְ'.
— Pl. חִיסּוּדִים. Pesik. Shek., p. 12 b (ref. to וחסד וכ', Prov. XIV, 34) מקבלין … ח' וכ' the Israelites must bear reproaches from the nations, when they sin.
Targ. O. Gen. XXXIV, 14 (ed. Berl. חִיסְדָּא). Targ. Prov. XIV, 31; s. fr. (interch. in ed. with חִיסְדָּא, חִסְרָּ').— Pl. חִיסּוּדִין, חִסּ'. Targ. Is. XXXVII, 3; a. e.
— Pl. חִיסּוּלִין, חִסּ'. Targ. Ps. CIII, 2 חִיסּוּלוֹי His perfect deeds (v. Ber. 10 a, h. text גמוליו).

sense.definition: the steel-coating of cutting tools, steel-edge (cmp. אִסְטְמָא).
sense.notes: Kel. XIII, 4 נטל חִיסּוּמָן if their steel-edge is worn off.

Y. Ber. IX, 14 a אין הארץ … לפי חִיסּוּמָה the earth drinks (absorbs the rain) only as far as its upper layer (crust) goes; Y. Taan. I, 64 b; Gen. R. s. 13, end; a. e.—Tosef. Ukts. II, 4 (T’bul Yom) ח' העליון (ed. Zuck. סל) the uppermost layer of the bone.
Cant. R. to IV, 11 אם חסרה ח' וכ' if she is suffering from the absence of one of them.
m. (חסח, reduplic. of חוס), v. next w.

sense.definition: (חָסַךְ) sparing, regard to expense in religious laws.
sense.notes: Men. 86 b (expl. התורה חסה וכ', v. חוּס); ib. 76 b חיסחון (Ms. Vatic. חיסכ'); a. e.
, v. חִסְנָא
, v. חֶסְרוֹן

sense.definition: (חיּף I, cmp. חוּפְיָא) [ sweep,] impetuous attack.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXVII, 4 (h. text שטף). Ib. III, 25 ed. Lag. (ed. חיסא, corr. acc.; h. text שֹׁאַת).
, pr. n. pl., v. חֵיפָה I

sense.definition: (חפף I; cmp. b. h. חֹף) border in webs.
sense.notes: Sabb. 96 b מטו הדדי בח' Ms. M. (Ar. חִיפָּה, חִפָּה, ed. חֶפֶת, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) the weavers, if placed near each other, would have touched one another on making the border.
f. h., v. preced. a. חֶפֶת.

sense.definition: Ḥ aifâ, Beth- Ḥ aifâ, a harbor of the Mediterranean Sea, south of Ptolemais.
sense.notes: Sabb. 26 a. Y. Erub. II, 20 a top (חיפא). Koh. R. to XII, 7 חיפס (corr. acc.). Meg. 24 b בית ח' (Ms. M. only ח').—Denom. חֵיפָנִי an inhabitant of Ḥ (noted for indiscriminate pronunciation of א a. ע). Ib.— Pl. חֵיפָנִין. Y. Ber. II, 4 d bot., v. ה"א.—V. חֵפָנִי.

sense.definition: (or חִיפָּה) f. (חפף I, חוף) ḥ efa (or ḥ ippa) a skin which has been salted, but has not gone through the consecutive stages of tanning with flour and gall-nut.
sense.notes: Sabb. 79 a; Gitt. 22 a. Sifra Sh’mini, Sh’ratsim, ch. VII, Par. 6 עור האֵיפָה.
Y. Ned. II, 37 b bot.; Y. Shebu. III, 34 d top, (Bab. ib. 28 b עֵיפָא, Ms. F. איפה). Y. R. Hash. I, 56 b top.
, v. חִפּוּי

sense.definition: (חפף I; cmp. חִיפָּא) border-stones, pegs or stakes along the road, to prevent vehicles from trespassing on private property.
sense.notes: [Rashi: from חפף II, pegs against which vehicles rub.] Sabb. 6 a
m. pl. h., constr. חִיפּוּפֵי same. Keth. 24 b

sense.definition: (חפף II) scabs, scurf, arising from uncleanness.
sense.notes: Yalk. Num. 787 (fr. Ned. 81 a, where ed. have עִירְבּוּבִיתָא, Ar. חרפופיתא, v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v. חרף). V. חֲפָפִית.

sense.definition: (חָפַשׂ) search, use of the root חפש.
sense.notes: Pes. 7 b we learn מציאה מח' the meaning of מצא (Ex. XII, 19) from the expression חפש (connected with מצא, Gen. XLIV, 12), i.e. you must search after leavened bread before Passover, &c.

sense.definition: [ mud-fish,] name of an unclean fish.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 39 a דהיה דמי לה' (Ms. לאי'). V. חָפִיתָא.
Sifra Sh’mini, Sh’ratsim, Par. 10, ch. XII; Ḥull. 67 b.—Par. IX, 2 (doubtful; perh. scorpion, v. next w.).

Cant. R. to I, 1 (prov.) מה ילדת ח' וכ' what does the beetle beget? Insects worse than itself; (Yalk. Sam. 134 חפושית, expl. scorpion).—Ab. Zar. 28 b ח' גמלניתא a large-sized beetle (Rashi: ‘ hanneton’, cockchafer).
, v. חִפָּזוֹן
, v. חֵיפָה I
, v. חַפְצָא
, v. חֵפְתָא
, v. חֵץ
— Pl. חִיצָאוֹת. Gen. R. s. 28 מפקיע בח' breaking into the screens (of the bridal chamber); Yalk. ib. 47 בחַיְיצָאוֹת.

sense.definition: (or חוּצָה) f. (חוּץ II, cmp. חָלִילָה) a strange act, unnatural deed.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 40 (play on חצה, Is. XXXIII, 7) חי' כתב read ḥ itsah, the angels cried חי' היא בידך מכושיני (read: מיכוס יתיה) it is unnatural on thy part to have him (Isaac) slaughtered; Gen. R. s. 56 ח' היא בִּרְיָה וכ' it is an outrage! A creature to kill his own son!; Yalk. Is. 303 חו' היא לך חו' היא לאבא למיכס ית בריה; Lam. R. to I, 2 חי' היא גביה וכ' it is unnatural for him (Abraham) &c., cmp. בָּרָיָיה.

sense.definition: (חוּץ, cmp. חַיִץ) partition, only in חִיצַת קנים single reeds planted around a well.
sense.notes: Erub. 15 a; 19 b; Succ. 24 b מחיצת; Tosef. Erub. II, 4 (Var. מחיצת); (Y. ib. II, 20 a אישות).—Tosef. Shebi. III, 19 חישת ed. Zuck. (Var. חִיצוֹת pl.). V. חִישָׁה.

sense.definition: (חָצָה) dividing off, esp. dividing the altar into two compartments by means of a net (Ex. XXVII, 5).
sense.notes: Zeb. 119 b יש ח' division is required.

Zeb. V, 1 מזבת הח' the outer altar (in the Temple court); a. fr.—Nidd. V, 1 בית הח' vagina.—Fem. חִיצוֹנָה. Y. Yeb. I, 3 a, v. חוּצָה II.—Num. R. s. 18 משנה הח' = בָּרַיְיתָא.— Pl. חִיצוֹנוֹת. Sabb. 31 b מפתחות הח' the outside keys (of the treasury); Yalk. Deut. 855; Yalk. Is. 302; En Yakob Sabb. l. c. (מפתחות) החִיצוֹנִית the keys to the outer room.

— Pl. חִיצוֹנִים. Meg. IV, 8 (24 b) דרך הח' the manner of the separatists (who follow their own interpretations of the Law, irrespective of public usages). Snh. X, 1 (90 a) ספרים הח' profane books, expl. Y. ib. 28 a top; Bab. ib. 100 b.— Fem. חִיצוֹנית, v. preced.
, v. חַצְרָא

M. Kat. 24 a a child יוצא בח' is carried out in one’s arms (without a coffin); Kidd. 80 b; Treat. S’maḥ. III, 2.—Y. M. Kat. III, beg. 81 c הניח ה' אמו וכ' left his mother’s lap (Palestine). Tosef. Yeb. IX, 4 מח' בעלה directly from the embrace of her husband; a. e.
Men. 97 b; Erub. 4 a (ref. to Ez. XLIII, 17), v. יְסוֹד.
Targ. II Sam. XII, 3, v. חֵנָא

sense.definition: (v. Josh. XIX, 34; I Chr. VI, 60) Ḥ ikok ( Ḥ ukok), in Northern Palestine.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. IX, beg. 38 c.—Denom.: חִיקוֹקָאָה, חִיקוֹקָיָא (חֲקוֹקָאָה, חֲקוֹקָא, חֲקוֹקָה) m. of Ḥ. Y. Pes. I, 27 c bot. יוחנן חי'; Bab. ib. 3 b חק' (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); a. e.
, Targ. Ps. LVII, 5, some ed., v. חֲרִי
, v. חִרְגָּא

sense.definition: (חוּר) cavernous rocks resembling human figures. Mekh. B’shall. s. 1 (ref. to Pi-Ha ḥ iroth, Ex. XIV,
מה ח' וכ' what was the nature of these rocks?—They were not slanting but abrupt &c. Ib.
sense.notes: הח' מצד וכ' the rocks were on one side, and Migdol &c. Ib. איו ח' אלא מקום חֵירוּתָן וכ' ḥ iroth means the place of Israel’s liberty (licentiousness); Yalk. Ex. 230; Num. R. s. 20.
, v. חֵירוּתָא

sense.definition: (חָרַם) exclusion, disassociation, esp. interdiction of travel between two countries at war with each other.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 38 a בשעת ח' at a time when commercial intercourse was cut off. Ib. b יהודה … ח' דמו Judaea and Galilee are generally to be considered as if in a state of interdiction (possession in one country is no valid claim when the owner lived in the other); Y. ib. III, 14 a top.
— Pl. חֵירוּפִין, חֵר'. Ex. R. s. 41, beg. Lev. R. s. 7; a. fr.
same. Targ. Y. Num. XVI, 27.

Mekh. B’shall. s. 1, v. חִירָה. Gitt. 42 a יצא לח' becomes free (ib. 8 b, a. fr. בן חוֹרִין). Erub. 54 a (play on חָרוּת, Ex. XXXII, 16) א"ת חרות אלא חי' read not ḥ aruth (engraven) but ḥ eruth (liberty) on the tablets (you are free, if you observe the law); Ex. R. s. 32, beg. ח' מן המלכיות liberation from political oppression, ח' ממלאך המות liberation from the angel of death (pestilence); a. fr.
Targ. Lev. XXV, 10. Targ. Is. LXI, 1; a. e.

sense.definition: (חֲרַז) a thorny shrub used for hedges.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 103 b Ar. Var., v. חִיזְרָא I.
Gitt. 57 b (ref. to Job V, 2) בחִירְחוּרֵי לשון תחבא in the contests of the tongue (prayer) thou shalt seek refuge (when persecuted).
, v. הֲדָיָא
Y. Meg. I, 70 a bot. (rendition of Yidãlah, Josh. XIX, 15; corresp. to El-Ḥariṭiye, on Fischer-Guthe’s Neue Handkarte v. Palaest.).
, v. חֶרְיָנָא
, v. חֶרְמָא
, v. אִירוֹנִית
— Pl. חִירְפֵי. Targ. Prov. XXX, 14 (ed. Lag. a. oth. חָרִיפֵי; h. text מאכלות).
, v. חִרְקָא
Targ. Y. Deut. XV, 17 (cmp. שִׁיחֲרוּר).
, v. חַרְשָׁא
— Pl. חִירָתָא. Targ. Ex. XIV, 2; Targ. Num. XXXIII, 7 פום ח', פומי ח' (h. text פי החירות, v. חִירָה).
, v. חוּשׁ

sense.definition: (v. חוּשׁ I) thicket, inaccessible place to be cleared by fire in order to be made arable, v. אַגָּם.
sense.notes: —(חֵישֶׁת) חִישַׁת קנים reed-thicket. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 a top המצית את האור בח' ק' he who sets fire to a reed-thicket; [Y. Shebi. IV, 35 b bot. באִישַׁת; Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 d bot. באשת, cmp. אוּשׁ a. אָשַׁשׁ].—Tosef. Shebi. III, 19, v. חִיצָה II.
Sabb. 75 a. Snh. 10 b
Targ. Job XX, 2 Ms a. Regia (ed. רְחִישְׁתָּא, a. רְגִישְׁתָּא).
ch, constr. חִישַׁת, same. Targ. Mic. III, 12; Targ. Jer. XXVI, 18 (h. text בָּמוֹת).

sense.definition: Ḥ ishta, a canal in Babylonia.
sense.notes: Pes. 40 b ed. (Ms. M. אישתא, cmp. חִישָׁה).

sense.definition: Ḥ eth, the eighth letter of the Alphabet.
sense.notes: Y. Peah VII, 20 b bot., a. e., v. ה"א. Lev. R. s. 19; a. fr.— Pl. חֵי"תִין. Y. Ber. II, 4 d bot. Sabb. 103 b
, v. חַיְיתָא
, v. חוּת
Nidd. 25 a ח' ידים וכ' indications (in the embryo) of hands and feet. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 c bot.

— Pl. חִיתּוּכִין, חִתּ'. Lam. R. to II, 1 (expl. תָּו, Ezek. IX, 4) ח' ופספס sentences and verdicts (Mus. s. v. פסיפון: כתיטא בפ' like the letter Θ, for θάνατος, at voting; Yalk. Ez. 349 only פס'; Ar. s. v. פספס: חתיכה פספסן, ed. pr. התֵּיבָה).
Ḥull. 47 b ח' דאוני the incisions marking the lobes of the lung.— Pl. חִיתּוּכֵי. Ib. 48 a ח' דאוני ed. (Rashi: מקום חיתוכה דאוני) the place in the neck where the lungs begin to separate.
Ib. 48 b מחטא … בח' דריאה (Rashi: בחִיתּוּכָהּ) a needle was found in a segment of the lungs.
B. Bath. X, 8 לאחר ח' שטרות after the deeds were signed. Ib. 176 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: (ברכות) ח' the formula with which a prayer closes, concluding benediction (‘Blessed be thou, O Lord. who &c.’).
sense.notes: Ber. 12 a הכל הולך אחר ח' ב' Ms. M. (ed. only הח') the concluding formula decides the appropriateness of a prayer. Ib. או אחר ח' ב' אזלינן Ms. M. (ed. חתימה) or do we go by the concluding phrase?— Pl. חִיתּוּמִין. Y. Ber. I, 3 d bot. אחר חִיתּוּמֵיהֶן according to their conclusions; (ib. חוֹתְמוֹתֵיהֶן, v. חוֹתָם); Y. Taan. II, 65 c bot.

sense.definition: (חָתַן) marriage; wedding ceremony, only in pl. חִיתּוּנִים, חִיתּוּנִין.
sense.notes: . Num. R. s. 12 (ref. to Cant. III, 1
ח' היו וכ' the law-giving on Sinai was a wedding (between God and Israel), as we read (Ex. XIX, 10) &c., v. קִידּוּשִׁין; Pesik. Vayhi, p. 5 a; Cant. R. to l. c. כחתנים (corr. acc.).
Targ. Y. Gen. XXXIV, 9.— Pl. חִיתּוּנִין. Targ. Y. Deut. VI, 7; XI, 19 חִיתּוּנֵיכוֹן (ed. Amst. חִיתּוּנְכוֹן sing.).
, Y. Snh. IV, end, 22 c, read: חִיטְּתָא.

sense.definition: being broken, subdued; esp. dread inspired by superiors, fear.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 34 (ref. to Gen. IX, 2, compared with I, 28) מורא וח' חזרו (not וחתות) the fear and dread (of man) were restored (after the deluge), but subjection was not. R. Hash. 17 a (applying Ez. XXXII, 24 sq.) שנתנו חִיתִּיתָם וכ' those (leaders) who tyrannize the land of the living.—Lev. R. s. 18; Koh. R. to XII, 5 (ref. to חתחתים, ib.) [read:] חִיתִּיתָהּ של דרך וכ' the dread of travelling befalls him.

Meir’s opinion …, recorded it in the Mishnah as the opinion of ‘scholars’. Ber. I, 1; a. v. fr.—חַכְמֵי אומות העולם gentile scholars (philosophers), חכמי ישראל Jewish scholars. R. Hash. 12 a. Ḥag. 15 b ת"ח אע"פ שסרח וכ' a scholar’s learning is not to be despised, even if he has gone astray. Ḥull. 9 a ת"ח צריך וכ' in order to be recognised as a Talmid Ḥ akham, one must have learned three things &c.; a. v. fr.— Pl. תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים. XXIV, 19; XXXIV, 26; Deut. XIV, 21). Pes. 54 b, v. חִידּוּשׁ.—Ḥull. 110 a לא גמירי דב' בח' אסור they did not know that boiling meat with milk was forbidden; a. fr.—חֲלֵב בֵּיצִים white of eggs. Y.
